item.description:
Pine Grove Cemetery Walking Tour - Part 2
Sunday, September 12, 2010
1:30 p.m.-3:30 p.m.
$5 MHA members - $10 general public
Pre-registration is required by calling (603)622-7531

Local historians Dick Duckoff and John P. Jordan will lead this tour through Manchester's only active municipal cemetery. The cemetery was first developed in 1851. Over the years the city made several additional land purchases, until the cemetery grew to around 275 acres. Many of Manchester's most prominent citizens were buried at Pine Grove. These include philanthropist Frank P. Carpenter, industrialist George A. Leighton and 13 Manchester mayors. Also buried there are some now forgotten people whose compelling stories will be retold. The cemetery includes beautiful monuments of many different designs, the Ursula Chapel built in 1905, the City Mausoleum built in 1980 and 17 family mausoleums. The tour will begin at the Ursula Chapel. Part 1 of this tour was held in June. This tour was rescheduled due to inclement weather.
item.name: Pine Grove Cemetery Walking Tour - Part 2
